effects.value: Follow-up: Maximum damage, and you may make another attack against the same target
Press the advantage: Double damage and, if this was a melee attack, you can make a DC 16 Strength (Atheletics) check to increase this to triple
Winded: Maximum damage
Bombardment: Double damage
Vexing cut: Double damage, and them target must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target cannot take take reactions until the end of your next turn
Between the shoulders: Maximum damage
Gut punch: Double damage
Guilding attack: Maximum damage and the target has disadvantage on saving throws against your spells for 1d4 rounds
Bloodied nose: Maximum damage
Neck wound: Double damage
Stunning blow: Maximum damage and the target must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target is stunned
Spell drain: Double damage, and the target must make a DC 12 saving throw using its spellcasting ability. On a failed save, the target is unable to cast spells on its next turn
Terrifying slash: Maximum damage, and the target must make a DC 12 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target is frightened of you until the end of its next turn
With a sharp stick. Double damage, and the target must make a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target loses an eye (DM decides which one)
Bonk of the noggin: Maximum damage
Spell storm: Double damage
Brow slash: Double damage, and the target is blinded until the end of its next turn
Right in the kisser: Maximum damage, and the target cannot speak for 1d4 rounds
Nighty night!: Double damage, and the target must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target is knocked unconscious
Magical barrage: Maximum damage, and an additional target within range is affected at half potency, or the spell's area of effect is increased by 5ft
Nave to chops: Double damage
Follow-up: Maximum damage, and you may make another attack with disadvantage against the same target
Soften 'em up: Double damage, and the target must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target has disadvantage on saving throws until the end of their next turn
Precise magic: Maximum damage
Slash to the ribs: Maximum damage
Poke in the belly: Double damage
Get back!: Maximum damage, and the target must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw. On a faild save, the target is pushed back 5ft
Terrifying display: Double damage, and all enemies that can see you must make a DC 12 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, they are frightened of you until the end of your next turn
Sliced tendon: Double damage, and the target's speed is reduced by 1/2 until the end of the target's next turn
In the knee: Maximum damage
Low blow: Double damage
Surge of power: Maximum damage, and you can immediately cast the same spell against the same target, expending a spell slot as normal
Sweep the legs: Maximum damage, and the target must make a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target is knocked prone
Pinned: Double damage, and the target is pinned to the ground and becomes restrained
Shin bash: Maximum damage
Blast of power: Double damage
Calf slash: Double damage
Target practice: Maximum damage, and any enemy of the target within range may make an attack of opportunity with disadvantage against it
...And stay down: Double damage, and the target must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target is knocked prone
Targeted spell: Maximum damage
Low slash: Maximum damage
Pierced thigh: Double damage
Something slipped: Maximum damage, and the targets AC is reducded by 1d4 until the end of its next turn
Big boom: Double damage. If this attack deals force or thunder damage the tareget is pushed back 1d4 x 5ft if it is Large of smaller, taking 1d6 bludgeoning damage for every 5 ft traveled
Slow recovery: Double damage, and the target must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target can make one less attack on their next turn
Shoulder jab: Maximum damage
Rap on the knuckles: Double damage
Resistance is futile: Maximum damage and, if the target is resistant to this damage type, it loses that resistance for 1 minute
You get what you pay for: Maximum damage, and you and the target must make a contested Strength check. If jthe target loses, their weapon is partially broken and deals 1/2 damage until it is repaired
Distracting jab: Double damage, and the target must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target has disadvantage on their next attack
Battered shoulder: Maximum damage
Eruption: Double damage
Forearm blow: Double damage
Find an opening: Maximum damage, and you have advantage on your next attack against the target
Drop it!: Double damage, and the target must make a DC 12 Strength or Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target drops what they are holding (DM decides which hand, or determines randomly)
Onslaught: Maximum damage
Slashing shoulder: Maximum damage
Pierced Hand: Double damage
Bruised joints: Maximum damage, and the target must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the taret has disadvantage on its next melee attack
Didn't want it anyway...: Double damage, and a non-magical item the target is holding or wearing is also affected by the damage type of this spell
Brow slash: Triple damage, and the target is blinded for 1d4 + 1 rounds
Pierced ear: Maximum damage, and roll the damage dice again
Bashed nose: Triple damage
Magical barrage: Maximum damage, and 2 additional target within range is affected at half potency, or the spell's area of effect is increased by 10ft
Terrifying slash: Maximum damage, and the target must make a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target is frightened of you for 2d4 rounds

Drop it!: Quadruple damage, and the target must make a DC 16 Strength or Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target drops what they are holding (DM decides which hand, or determines randomly)
Onslaught: Maximum double damage
Slashed shoulder: Maximum double damage
Pierced Hand: Quadruple damage
Bruised joints: Maximum damage, and the target must make a DC 16 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the taret has disadvantage on attacks for 2d4 + 2 rounds
Didn't want it anyway...: Quadruple damage, and three items the target is holding or wearing is also affected by the damage type of this spell
Don't lose your head!: Quadruple damage and, if the damage the target takes is equal to or greater than 1/2 of their maximum hit points, they are decapitated
Pressure point: Quadruple damage, and the target must make a DC 18 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target is paralised
Nighty night!: Quadruple damage, and if the damage the target takes is great than 1/4 of its maximum hit points, it is knocked unconscious
Rejuvenation: Quadruple damage, and you regain a spell slot. Roll a d6 to determine the level of the spell slot
Gutted: Quadruple damage and, if the damage the target takes is equal to or greater than 1/2 of their macimum hit points, they are disemboweled
Show through the heart: Quadruple damage, and the target loses 1/4 of their maximum hit points at the beginning of their turn for 3 rounds
Tenderiser: Quadruple damage, and the target becomes vulnerable to bludgeoning damage for 1 minute
Detonation: Quadruple damage, and all creatures within 15 ft of the target are also affected
I never touched a drop!: Quadruple damage, if the damage the target takes is equal to or great than 1/4 of their maximum hit points, they lose a leg
Chink in the armour: Quadruple damage, and if the target becomes vulnerable to piercing damage for 1 minute
Shattered knee: Quadruple damage, and the target's speed is reduced by 1/2. Additionall, for every 5ft the target moves, it takes 1d6 damage
Blink and you'll miss it: Quadruple damage, and the target must make a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target is unable to see you for 1 minute
Disarmed: Quadruple damage, and if the damage the target takes is equal to or freater than 1/2 of their maximum hit points, they lose an arm/hand
Distracting jab: Quadruple damage, and the target has disadvantage until the end of the encounter
Crushed hand: Quadruple damage, and the target loses use of one of its arms or hands

Terrifying display: Quadruple damage, and all enemies that can see you must make a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, they are frightened of you. An enemy can repeat this saving throw at the end of its turn to stop being frightened
